Please support temporary privileged mode for powerhsell. Bash allows temporary privileged mode by prefixing a command with sudo. In powershell, this entails spawning the whole shell under sudo which means that all commands run privileged which an anti-pattern for shell use in the UNIX world. Usage of sudo should be intercepted so that sudo starts a powershell process that runs the command/cmdlet then exits immediately instead of letting sudo start just a bash shell which would not support cmdlets.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```sudo Update-Help```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```The Update-Help cmdlet runs in admin privilege in a temporary powershell instance```

Actual behavior
---------------

```The sudo command ends up spawning a privileged bash instance which obviously knows nothing about PWSH cmdlets```
